TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HitTestInfo extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Contains information about a part of the at a specified coordinate.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
The HitTestInfo class, in conjunction with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.HitTest%2A> method of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> is used to determine which part of an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> the user has clicked. The HitTestInfo class contains the location and associated designer that was clicked.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner designer, valuetype System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestLocations location) cil managed

Docs.param: The location on the associated that was clicked.
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of a object.
Gets the associated with the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The AssociatedDesigner property stores a reference to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo> object. Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> to reference extended information about the designer associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>.

Docs.summary: Returns the bounds of the area hit.
Docs.value: A rectangle that encloses the associated with the object or an empty rectangle if the object is not associated with a designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The bounds will describe the area on the screen that was hit, usually the area that encloses the associated <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>.

Docs.summary: Contains information about where the hit occurred.
Docs.value: A that describes the area hit.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the HitLocation to determine on what area of the designer the hit occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 MapToIndex() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the index of the hit designer.
Docs.returns: The index of the designer hit by the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the value returned by MapToIndex to determine which designer was hit. This is useful for insertion or deletion operations.
## Remarks Use `Nowhere` to get an empty <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>.

Docs.summary: Gets a selectable object associated with the hit area.
Docs.value: A selectable object associated with the hit area or a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if no designer is associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use `SelectableObject` to get the selectable object associated with the hit area. If a designer is associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>, SelectableObject will return the activity associated with the designer, or null reference (`Nothing`) if no designer is associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>.

Docs.summary: Gets the user data associated with the .
Docs.value: A new dictionary for user data, or a reference to the existing user data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use UserData to store user information about the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>. If no user data has been stored, calling UserData creates a new, empty dictionary for use.
